text: In the Circus Directorate's office, a slender man appeared one afternoon, with a cessable type and a dissected cat. The director asked him what he was doing. He said he was an illusionist, and he made objects and people disappear. The fat director, who was playing with a dime, as if holding it in his hand, was thinking of a move on the green carpet, said laughing: "Why don't you make me disappear? The illusionist unbuttoned the American woman's fists and shirt, pulled out the long pencil that was his magic wand and hit the director in the bald head and made him disappear. Then he got a little thoughtful and decided not to make it appear again. Since then he's been the director of the circus, the illusionist. FIN
title: El ilusionista
author: Ramón Gómez de la Serna
